figaro.threeDvolume module

class figaro.threeDvolume.VolumeReconstruction(max_dist, out_folder='.', prior_pars=(0.001, array([[0.0001, 0., 0.], [0., 0.0001, 0.], [0., 0., 0.0001]]), 10, array([0., 0., 0.])), alpha0=1, n_gridpoints=[720, 360, 100], name='skymap', labels=['$\\alpha$', '$\\delta$', '$D\\ [Mpc]$'], levels=[0.5, 0.9], latex=False, incr_plot=False, glade_file=None, cosmology={'h': 0.674, 'ol': 0.685, 'om': 0.315}, n_gal_to_plot=-1, region_to_plot=0.9, entropy=False, n_entropy_MC_draws=1000.0, true_host=None, host_name='Host', entropy_step=1, entropy_ac_step=500, n_sign_changes=5, virtual_observatory=False)[source]

Bases: DPGMM

Class to reconstruct the 3D probability density given a set of samples or during a PE run. Child class of DPGMM class (defined in mixture.py)

Parameters:

  • max_dist (double) – maximum distance (in Mpc)

  • out_folder (str or Path) – output folder

  • prior_pars (tuple) – NIW prior parameters (k, L, nu, mu - see https://www.cs.ubc.ca/~murphyk/Papers/bayesGauss.pdf)

  • alpha0 (double) – initial guess for concentration parameter

  • n_gridpoints (list-of-int) – number of gridpoints for each dimension (ra, dec, dist). Default is set to have a 0.25 deg^2 resolution

  • name (str) – name to be given to output folders and files

  • labels (list-of-str) – plot labels

  • levels (list-of-double) – credible levels (between 0 and 1)

  • latex (bool) – if True, LaTeX is used for plots (if available)

  • incr_plot (bool) – if True, produce plots at fixed number of samples. Otherwise, skymaps are produced at the end of the inference only

  • glade_file (str or Path) – file containing GLADE+ (hdf5 file created using the create_glade.py pipeline)

  • cosmology (dict) – dictionary containing h = H0/100 km/(s*Mpc), om (matter density parameter) and ol (cosmological constant density). Default from Planck (2021)

  • n_gal_to_plot (int) – number of galaxies to include in galaxy plots

  • region_to_plot (double) – credible region to plot

  • entropy (bool) – use entropy to assess convergence and begin producing skymaps

  • true_host (list-of-double) – position of the true host, if known

  • host_name (str) – host name, for plotting purposes

  • entropy_step (int) – interval (expressed as number of draws) between two subsequent entropy evaluations

  • entropy_ac_step (int) – window lenght for entropy angular coefficient

  • n_sign_changes (int) – number of zero-crossings before beginning producing skymaps (requires entropy = True)

  • virtual_observatory (bool) – places the virtual observatory fov behind galaxy plots. Warning: under development, might not work

Returns:

instance of VolumeReconstruction class

Return type:

VolumeReconstruction

add_new_point(x)[source]

Update the probability density reconstruction adding a new sample Sample must be in celestial coordinate and in the following order: [ra, dec, dist].

Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – sample

compute_credible_levels_host()[source]

Compute credible levels for true host (if provided)

density_from_samples(samples)[source]

Reconstruct the probability density from a set of samples. Samples must be in celestial coordinate and in the following order: [ra, dec, dist].

Parameters:

samples (iterable) – set of volume samples

evaluate_catalog(final_map=False)[source]

Evaluate the probability of being the host for each entry in the galaxy catalog and rank it accordingly. If the inference is finished, save credible areas/volumes.

Parameters:

final_map (bool) – flag to raise if the inference is finished

evaluate_skymap()[source]

Marginalise volume map over luminosity distance to get the 2D skymap and compute credible areas

evaluate_volume_map()[source]

Evaluate volume map and compute credbile volumes

Initialise the mixture to initial conditions to analyse a new event.

Parameters:

  • out_folder (str or Path) – new output folder

Load GLADE+ from hdf5 file. This is tailored to the GLADE+ hdf5 file created by the create_glade.py pipeline.

Parameters:

glade_file (str or Path) – glade file to be uploaded

Produce volume map as 3D and 2D scatter plot of galaxies, if a catalog is provided.

Parameters:

  • n_gals (int) – number of galaxies to plot
